Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably an amphora or hydria; exterior: black-figure decoration in two animal friezes (above: legs of cock, to right; part of tail feathers of second cock at right; below: part of head, neck with added red and shoulder of lion, to right).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 454, no. B761)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0092) (Phase 1)
